category: Member Sports Organization Regulations/Article 33 (Approval of Executive Officers, etc.)
contents: Article 33 (Approval of officers, etc.) ① A person who wishes to become the president of a city/provincial sports organization must obtain approval from the city/provincial sports association by attaching a letter of approval of the member sports organization. Revised 2021. 10. 6. ② Member sports organizations must reply to the relevant city/provincial sports council within 30 days as to whether they agree to approval pursuant to paragraph 1, and if there is no reply by the deadline, they are deemed to have agreed. Revised 2016. 6. 16., 2017. 3. 23., 2021. 10. 6. ③ If the president of a city/provincial sports organization approved by the city/provincial sports council has grounds for disqualification of an executive or other unsuitable reasons for approval, If this is revealed, the Sports Council may request the city/provincial sports council to cancel or withdraw approval, and in this case, the city/provincial sports council must comply. Newly established 2016. 6. 16., 2017. 3. 23., 2021. 10. 6. ④ The Secretary General of the City/Provincial Sports Council may first approve the approval of executives of city/provincial sports organizations upon delegation from the Board of Directors, and the next This must be reported to the board of directors. ⑤ City/provincial sports organizations shall apply the composition requirements of executives pursuant to Article 22 (3), but may vary the composition ratio of executives depending on the special characteristics of the relevant region and sport with the approval of the city/provincial sports council. Newly established 2017. 8. 7., 2021. 10. 6.
